column4: mv *.asp *.htm   I'm trying to rename *.asp to *.html and than I get message: mv: end,*.html` not a directory ...
are you sure mv accepts wild-cards in both source and destination?
any other suggestions to rename files with wildcards ?
I'd do something like this "for a in $(ls *.asp); do mv $a $a.html; done" it will turn mypage.asp into mypage.asp.html... you can probably tweak that into what you want
and there are applications available for doing renames
second try  "for a in $(ls *.asp | cut -d . -f 1); do mv $a.asp $a.html; done"  this ought to work
you've done a search on mp3 cut ?
adobes plugin is the only one that is remotely useful if you ask me
rescue mode? I thought it was called recovery mode.. I might be wrong though
if we're talking about the same thing it will just give you a root terminal.. so you can change passwords and such if you've forgotten them
yes? I think I qualify as anyone
do you know what packages do I need or how can I install prerequirements for using openbox from server?
oh.. I have no idea.. if you just wanted attention to your question you should have just asked it again.. just wait 15 minutes or so before repeating
